title: 11-Year-Old Chinese Boy Writes 600 Lines Of Code To Build Rocket
content: Yan's interest in rockets began when he witnessed the Long March-2 liftoff at the age of four.
summary: Yan's interest in rockets began when he witnessed the Long March-2 liftoff at the age of four.

title: How El Chapo's Son Helped US Arrest Famous Narco Chief El Mayo
content: As a propeller plane on Thursday whirred towards the U.S.-Mexico border to cross illegally, U.S. agents raced to meet it at a small municipal airport near El Paso, Texas, and arrest two men who were part of Mexican drug trafficking royalty.
summary: As a propeller plane on Thursday whirred towards the U.S.-Mexico border to cross illegally, U.S. agents raced to meet it at a small municipal airport near El Paso, Texas, and arrest two men who were part of Mexican drug trafficking royalty.

title: Donald Trump Tells Christians They Won't Have To Vote After This Election
content: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump told Christians on Friday that if they vote for him this November, "in four years, you don't have to vote again. We'll have it fixed so good, you're not gonna have to vote."
summary: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump told Christians on Friday that if they vote for him this November, "in four years, you don't have to vote again. We'll have it fixed so good, you're not gonna have to vote."

title: 170 Killed, Hundreds Wounded In Days-Long Israeli Operation In Gaza
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said Saturday that Israel's military operation around Khan Yunis has killed about 170 people and wounded hundreds since it started on Monday.
summary: Gaza's civil defence agency said Saturday that Israel's military operation around Khan Yunis has killed about 170 people and wounded hundreds since it started on Monday.

title: Blinken Raises Concern Over China's "Provocative" Actions Around Taiwan
content: The United States hailed "open and productive" discussions between China's foreign minister and Secretary of State Antony Blinken in Laos on Saturday in which Blinken raised US concerns over Beijing's "provocative actions" around Taiwan.
summary: The United States hailed "open and productive" discussions between China's foreign minister and Secretary of State Antony Blinken in Laos on Saturday in which Blinken raised US concerns over Beijing's "provocative actions" around Taiwan.

title: Passengers Struggle As France Suffers Second Day Of Sabotage Train Delays
content: Tens of thousands of rail passengers struggled through a second day of cancelled trains Saturday as investigators tracked saboteurs who paralysed the network just ahead of the Paris Olympics opening ceremony.
summary: Tens of thousands of rail passengers struggled through a second day of cancelled trains Saturday as investigators tracked saboteurs who paralysed the network just ahead of the Paris Olympics opening ceremony.

title: As Racist Attacks Fly, Republicans Grapple With How To Take On Harris
content: Republican nominee Donald Trump has called her "crazy," "nuts" and "dumb as a rock." Republicans in Congress disparage her as a diversity hire.
summary: Republican nominee Donald Trump has called her "crazy," "nuts" and "dumb as a rock." Republicans in Congress disparage her as a diversity hire.

title: Killer Whales Sink Yacht In Mediterranean Sea In Harrowing 2-Hour Attack
content: The pod of five first targeted the rudder, rendering the sailboat unable to steer after approximately 15 strikes.
summary: The pod of five first targeted the rudder, rendering the sailboat unable to steer after approximately 15 strikes.

title: French Rail Chief Says Trains To Run Normally From Monday After Sabotage
content: Traffic on France's high-speed rail network should be back to normal by Monday, Transport Minister Patrice Vergriete said after sabotaged signal stations and cables caused travel chaos on Friday, the opening day of the Olympic Games.
summary: Traffic on France's high-speed rail network should be back to normal by Monday, Transport Minister Patrice Vergriete said after sabotaged signal stations and cables caused travel chaos on Friday, the opening day of the Olympic Games.

title: Kamala Harris Cuts Down Donald Trump's Lead Sharply, Show Latest Polls
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris, the most likely candidate to replace Joe Biden as the Democratic Party nominee for the November 5 presidential elections, has narrowed the margin against Donald Trump, according to latest polls.
summary: US Vice President Kamala Harris, the most likely candidate to replace Joe Biden as the Democratic Party nominee for the November 5 presidential elections, has narrowed the margin against Donald Trump, according to latest polls.

title: At Least 30 Killed, Over 100 Wounded In Israeli Strike School In Gaza
content: At least 30 Palestinians were killed in an Israeli strike on a school in Deir al Balah in central Gaza, Palestinian health officials said, and the Israeli military said it had struck a Hamas command centre.
summary: At least 30 Palestinians were killed in an Israeli strike on a school in Deir al Balah in central Gaza, Palestinian health officials said, and the Israeli military said it had struck a Hamas command centre.

title: Pak Woman Killed By Brothers For Wanting To Marry 3rd Time: Report
content: A Karachi woman was allegedly murdered by her brothers on Friday as she wanted to get married for the third time, Pakistan-based ARY News reported, citing police reports.
summary: A Karachi woman was allegedly murdered by her brothers on Friday as she wanted to get married for the third time, Pakistan-based ARY News reported, citing police reports.

title: Blinken Meets Chinese Counterpart After Chiding Beijing's Actions At Sea
content: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken met his Chinese counterpart Wang Yi on Saturday during a regional summit in Laos, hours after criticising Beijing's "escalating and unlawful actions" in the South China Sea.
summary: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken met his Chinese counterpart Wang Yi on Saturday during a regional summit in Laos, hours after criticising Beijing's "escalating and unlawful actions" in the South China Sea.

title: NASA Aims To Restore Space Station Traffic As Sunita Williams Remains Stuck
content: NASA is grappling with an impending congestion at the International Space Station (ISS) due to recent delays and technical issues involving SpaceX and Boeing, as the space agency works to restore smooth traffic flow to and from the orbiting laborator
summary: NASA is grappling with an impending congestion at the International Space Station (ISS) due to recent delays and technical issues involving SpaceX and Boeing, as the space agency works to restore smooth traffic flow to and from the orbiting laborator

title: Small Plane Crashes In Front Lawn Of US Home: ''Felt Like Explosion''
content: CCTV footage of the incident showed the plane slamming onto the lawn and skidding towards the porch before stopping shy of it.
summary: CCTV footage of the incident showed the plane slamming onto the lawn and skidding towards the porch before stopping shy of it.

title: 3 Bangladesh Student Leaders Taken Into Custody For Their Own Safety
content: Bangladesh said three student leaders had been taken into custody for their own safety after the government blamed their protests against civil service job quotas for days of deadly nationwide unrest.
summary: Bangladesh said three student leaders had been taken into custody for their own safety after the government blamed their protests against civil service job quotas for days of deadly nationwide unrest.

title: At Olympics Opening Ceremony, Drag Parody Of 'The Last Supper' Draws Flak
content: The opening ceremony of the Paris Olympics 2024 has courted a massive controversy over the drag queen-themed apparent parody of "The Last Supper," a mural painting by Renaissance artist Leonardo da Vinci of Jesus and his apostles.
summary: The opening ceremony of the Paris Olympics 2024 has courted a massive controversy over the drag queen-themed apparent parody of "The Last Supper," a mural painting by Renaissance artist Leonardo da Vinci of Jesus and his apostles.

title: US Elections: Trump Holds Narrow Lead Over Kamala Harris In Latest Poll
content: The US presidential race between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump is incredibly close, showed a new media poll, revealing a surge in support for Harris among non-white voters and a significant rise in enthusiasm among Democrats for her campaign.
summary: The US presidential race between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump is incredibly close, showed a new media poll, revealing a surge in support for Harris among non-white voters and a significant rise in enthusiasm among Democrats for her campaign.

title: Pak Fear Mounts As Final Outcome Of Loan Talks With China Appears Bleak
content: Concerns are escalating within Pakistan's financial sector as negotiations with Chinese authorities over rescheduling energy sector loans have encountered complications, Dawn reported.
summary: Concerns are escalating within Pakistan's financial sector as negotiations with Chinese authorities over rescheduling energy sector loans have encountered complications, Dawn reported.

title: Day After "Massive Attack", A Big Update From French Railways
content: Seven out of 10 French high-speed trains will run Saturday on three key routes, a day after saboteurs paralysed much of the train network as the Olympic Games started in Paris.
summary: Seven out of 10 French high-speed trains will run Saturday on three key routes, a day after saboteurs paralysed much of the train network as the Olympic Games started in Paris.
